cscie97.asn4.test

Class TestDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.test.TestDriver

  • public class TestDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    Test harness for the CSCI-E 97 Assignment 2. Reads in several supplied input files to load Country objects, Device objects, then Content items, and finally runs several search queries against the IProductAPI to find the content that was loaded.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    Importer, IProductAPI, Content, ContentSearch

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes the primary test logic. Accepts four command line arguments that should be CSV files. Command-line arguments should be:
        1. filename of Countries CSV datafile
        2. filename of Devices CSV datafile
        3. filename of Products CSV datafile
        4. filename of Content Search Queries CSV datafile
        5. filename of Collections CSV datafile
        Calls several methods on the Importer class to load the CSV datafile arguments, including ContentImporter.importCountryFile(String guid, String filename), ContentImporter.importDeviceFile(String guid, String filename), ContentImporter.importContentFile(String guid, String filename) and CollectionImporter.importCollectionsFile(String guid, String filename). Once all Counties, Devices, and Content are loaded, calls SearchEngine.executeQueryFilename(String filename) to import a CSV of queries to run against the ProductAPI for content items. CollectionImporter.importCollectionsFile(String guid, String filename) will create new collections, add content items to collections, define the content serch criteria for DynamicCollections, and execute searches for text on actual collections themselves. All content item search queries and results, and collection search queries and results, are printed to standard out.
        Parameters:
        args - first argument should a CSV datafile of Countries, second argument should be a CSV datafile of Devices, third argument should be a CSV datafile of Content items, fourth argument should be a CSV datafile of content search query parameters, and fifth (and last) argument should be a CSV datafile of collection definitions, adding content to collections, defining dynamic collection search criteria, and collection searches
